headline: 'Gutfeld!' on Ukraine war, Jussie Smollett sentencing
subHeadline: Guests: Bill Hemmer, Tyrus, Kat Timpf, Dagen McDowell

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello, we're back. Lots of news went on while we were apart. Pete Davidson and Kim Kardashian are still together. It's the couple that makes me ask, would World War III be such a bad thing? But we've been off for a few weeks. And for good reason, this is a news channel and war is news. Actually, it's breaking news. And it's breaking all the time. But you can't spell breaking news without a break. And sometimes we do need a break. But first, let's assess what we know.

utterances.speaker: KAMALA HARRIS, VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: So, Ukraine is a country in Europe. It exists next to another country called Russia. Russia is a bigger country. Russia is a powerful country. Russia decided to invade a smaller country called Ukraine. So basically, that's wrong.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, I love how she speaks to me. Like I have a head injury. Maybe I do. But it's true. Russia invaded Ukraine. And like Joe Biden reading a children's book, what assumed would take days is now nearly a month. And with every passing day, things just get more desperate. Meanwhile, my mother-in-law escaped from Ukraine to Poland. And no, she didn't write out on her broom. She got out with a help of some very amazing people, which I'll get into in a second. But now my wife is out there and Warsaw trying to figure out a way for her mom to get home. Which means I'm all alone. But I've been trying to keep busy. You know, it's been really tough. But I've managed to make some sympathetic friends. Look, I had to do something. Changing all the locks on the doors of the apartment only took about an hour. But in all seriousness, thanks to Fox, I was able to get my mother-in-law out of Kiev. It's a pretty amazing tale. They picked her up in a small village and drove for hours, days even and was able to get her out of danger in Poland. I believe they did this so I could use my new mother-in-law jokes. For example, my mother-in-law was stuck in Kiev and to pose the dilemma, get her out or blocker on Facebook. Yes. Dead silence. But seriously, my wife wanted me to send somebody in to get her, I would have but I have a one- star rating on Uber. My mother-in-law was stuck in Kiev, and to be honest, I'm not crazy about her. So, after hours of arguing about it, we came to an agreement. If rescued, I'm back in her will. Wow. But enough. In all honesty she made it insane trek across the country and made it out alive, thanks to a hearty band of Fox News employees who didn't even know her but off offered to help. I mean, who knew Dagen McDowell knew how to make Molotov cocktails out of hand sanitizer and a bottle of Purell? And who knew Kat could drink those? Here's my mother-in-law reunited with her daughter, my wife, Elena. I haven't seen my wife that happy since I moved into the guest room. But I have Fox News's Scott Wilder, Trey Yingst and Steve Harrigan among others to thank for this. So, it's obvious. The war in Ukraine is an ugly, bloody thing. It's also a war between competing narratives. Some are persuasive, but also confusing in this new fog of war. It's always two movies on one screen. Ukraine is fighting and winning, and Russia is about to crush them. You alternate between screens, often with the same visuals. They say truth is the first casualty of war, but it's really perspective. And you start to find yourself moving from one stage of hopeful belief to one of cynicism. First, you're naive. Did you hear about the Phantom of Ukraine shooting down jets? Did you hear about the Ukrainian sailors refusing to surrender? Did you hear about Gutfeld's mother-in-law killing her captors with a can of hairnet? Turns out a lot of these stories aren't quite true, but are just meant to inspire. They serve a purpose but they turn you from a naive consumer of news to a pissed off cynic like me. Problem is that is bad. That's as bad as being naive. Because for us, we want the truth. But in an era of social media and the internet, fables traveled to the sun and back before the truth puts on its crocs. My gardener said that. So, all we can do is watch and listen and hope for the best and the best we could hope for that this (BLEEP) stupid horrible thing ends as soon as possible.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Lert's welcome tonight's guests. He's like my stovetop, so hot that I have to remind myself not to touch him. Co-anchor of America's new newsroom, Bill Hemmer.

utterances.speaker: BILL HEMMER, FOX NEWS CHANNEL ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: It would be the new room too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The nude -- how about the nude room? She's got more southern charm than a leprechaun cooking grits. Fox Business anchor Dagen McDowell. She's like a mop, a stick with fake hair that spent a lot of time in the arms of janitors. Fox News Contributor Kat Timpf. And when he springs forward, it causes an earthquake. My massive side kick and the NWA World Television Champion, Tyrus. All right, Tyrus. I'm going to go to you first, even though I got the consummate newsman to my left, I'm going to go to you because you're probably the only person here that we have heard -- well, we haven't heard anything. You've been --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: I got out of town.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You got out of town.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: -- low.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, I'm interested in your perspective. What you think as you watch this unfold on the television?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Well, first things first, I think we got to give credit words to Bill, Mr. Hemmer, you have been outstanding, phenomenal. And Greg, I hardly ever go on social media. But you have taken a tough stand, and you've got a lot of help for it. And I support you a thousand percent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, thank you.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: And it takes -- it's not an easy thing to do in times like this. You know, and every time you give a compliment like that, you have to go back and say what is going on Ukraine is horrible.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: But what's going on here is just is horrible in terms of what information is real and what is not. The American people and myself, we get confused because this administration hasn't been straight with us on one thing and we've been hit with a lot of tough things. We had the pandemic, we have deal -- we're dealing with inflation. There was the -- there was supposed influences in our elections. There was all these things that were happening and we never get the straight and narrow from. They're given Emmys to their own. And then we eventually find out six months later, that we were on the wrong side of everything. Now, I'm not acquainting that to what's going on in Russia because Putin is what he is, and we all know what he is. But getting the information has been extremely difficult. And I left it to the experts. I felt it was best to stay out of this fight. And that's why people like yourself who stood up, I'm just proud of you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, thank you. And you know, agree. I think Hemmer, you've been doing a smashing job with that giant board. The billboard as they've called it. And it makes me forget that you're wearing the silliest shoe.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Oh, the worst.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: With the silliest -- the silliest shoe laces. Those shoe laces cannot remain tied for more than five minutes. Maybe you like it that way, Bill. Maybe like the slip off. But I want to ask you something.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: By the way, they were free.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know, you know.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: That's why --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: And they match great. You don't got to answer to him. Look what he's wearing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm wearing Prada.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: He usually wears velvet strap shoes, so don't worry about it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK. So, Bill.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Tyrus brings up the point that I brought up earlier and he's right. I got some serious (BLEEP) for it, but I was trying to address the fog of war. How do we know when we know that we're being persuaded, where the media is now a persuasion device? How do we know -- because like I feel like we're going to go to war.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Yes. I'd say it's persuasive times 20 now with social media.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: I've seen that. It's great to have you back, by the way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: America missed you. I'd come over there and hug you, but they'd start talking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, you know what.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: We're already talking.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'd be whispering in your ear.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: You know, I don't know how to address all that. Maybe in time. That'd be a good moment to look back on it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: But I just think our leaders have thoroughly failed us in the world and all of this. This war did not have to happen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: And the people we have in charge have led us down. And they -- leaders are supposed to lead you around humanitarian international disasters. They're not supposed to lead you into them. And it's such a crisis of leadership. Point number one. Point number two, I don't think the western world tie truly understood the evilness of Vladimir Putin. I think in Ukraine, they probably did. But for us, Aleppo was a planet away.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Grozny, Chechnya was a planet away the refugees in Syria with the Southeastern Turkey. We have -- we couldn't even pronounce the name of the towns. But now the Ukrainians are going to Poland. And after Poland, they're going to go to Germany, then it was Italy earlier today than it'll be England, it'd be the United States. Well, these are all places that we as Americans associate with Europe, summer vacation, college education, et cetera. It's -- we have an ability to relate to these people in a way that we could never during the misdeeds and dare I say evilness of Putin --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Such a good point.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: -- for the past 20 years.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: When you mentioned Chechnya and things like that, it's -- for a lot of people that's the first time they hear and I couldn't explain that without first having to read Wikipedia. Because we -- it was something that wasn't part of our consciousness. It was not part of the world. But this you cannot -- it's there. I mean, we -- you're watching a ground war happening in Europe on T.V. And yet you do feel that there's this other layer going on. Kat, as a libertarian, you support all wars?

utterances.speaker: KAT TIMPF, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: So glad to be back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We missed you, Kat. What's your take on this? I'm dying to hear.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: As you say, I've also not been on T.V. in 2-1/2 weeks.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: So, it's great to start with such this light hearted topic, which I am such an expert. But I -- again, I think you just need to be so careful with this idea of do something, do something because a lot of times are doing something can sometimes make things worse, if you talk about something like a no-fly zone, where, you know, nuclear war, like a war between nuclear powers. A lot of people die in that situation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I think that, you know, it is upsetting and it is awful everything we're seeing, but we got to be really, really, really, really careful in terms of how you approach it and making things potentially worse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. And also, with nuclear war the effect on climate change.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: That's the most important thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes, it is. I mean, aside from two or 300,000 --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: -- by the way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. That was an amazing point to make. Dagen, what -- I haven't heard from you and I've been seeing you in since we went Dallas. Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: She's been killing it on "THE FIVE." She's been killing it on "THE FIVE," Greg.

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, FOX BUSINESS NETWORK ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: I literally hug you and said I love you.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: She was at the same table with you as "THE FIVE."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's just say that I have spent a lot of time alone.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And no. Maybe I might have had a little too much wine. So, there's a lot of memory. Just that a little foggy.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I hug you and said I love you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, now I feel really bad.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: As you should.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I did a lot of other stuff. So, you know, I remember that. I just thought you invited me on the program to discuss the use of steroids.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do you believe that? That baboon is taking steroids?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I have a deep knowledge throughout my history of men using steroids, it's totally possible. He's a little doughy kind of like post steroid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: You got to work out when you take the shot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: And I agree. Right. He looks like he's not, you know, get in the gym and (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Fifty percent doesn't get it done.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I have -- I have a lot -- I don't trust the media like there was a video of these two Ukrainian children who were cheered by their new school in Italy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: And I didn't trust it. I like blue the image up now. That looks like Arkansas to me. There's the anything that's on the internet, I think - -

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I hope that's real. Was that not real? It was Italy.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: No, no. I'm --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. But it's your own -- your brain.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I'm like --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's where I'm at. My brain --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: That could be Kansas.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. My brain, I don't trust anything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think everything taught. What do you call it? A deep fake?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Well, in defense and to Bill's point when we're getting drunk in history by Kamala --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: It's a little difficult. You know, we are first world problems in this country seeing real problems and there's a shock going on right now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: But what you can trust is you follow the money and you follow the oil and natural gas. And at the very beginning of Biden's term, I said it's a mistake to try and destroy our energy, prosperity and power because you see that two nations that hate us, like Vladimir Putin. Every incident of aggression by Putin, in the last 20 years is directly correlated to sky high oil prices.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Interest.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: So you send oil up, he invades Georgia, he annexes Crimea, and now this. But now what you're saying, the energy is still flowing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: It's going to Europe. It's at the highest-level natural gas to Europe, as it has been throughout the war on Ukraine so far. China's still buying it, the vast majority of it -- of Russia's oil exports are still hitting the market. Money's flowing to the Kremlin. And you have a rapid realignment of world powers where China, Xi Jinping is getting invited to Saudi Arabia, and China is getting even closer to Russia because of Biden's weakness.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There you go.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Are we to think now that in all these summits with Biden, before that Trump, Obama, Bush, did Putin give a damn about cybersecurity? Do we think this now? All Putin cared about was Russian history.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: And all he cared about was real estate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Why didn't we report on that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Old school.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: I found this -- they met in Geneva, it's in June. Ukraine was mentioned one time and a summary recap of the entire summit. And that's a disservice to the American people, to the Western world.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Now we know what Putin cared about.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right. Exactly.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: We never got to that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. All right. We've got a lot to get to. Up -- that's a transition. Ah. Up next, are liberals coming around now that Russian troops are on the ground?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There we go. As the war in Ukraine scrambled the liberal brain, will Biden star fall even lower if he's lost Bill Maher and Trevor Noah? Yes, pretty good, huh? True world leaders won't take Biden's calls as liberal comics finally grow some balls. Bill Maher close to show Friday with one simple question.

utterances.speaker: BILL MAHER, HOST, REAL TIME WITH BILL MAHER
utterances.sentences: If Putin thought Trump was really that supportive of him, why didn't he invade when Trump was in office? It's at least worth asking that question if you're not locked into one intransigent thought.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Hmm. Great question, Bill. Concerning a recent Harvard poll that was my porn stage name, show that 62 percent of voters think Putin would not have attacked if Trump were still around. Meanwhile, Daily Show host Trevor Noah offers a rant that leaves us wondering what the hell happened to him.

utterances.speaker: TREVOR NOAH, HOST, THE DAILY SHOW
utterances.sentences: Apparently, Saudi Arabia won't even pick up the phone for the President of the United States. It must have been really embarrassing for Biden, can you imagine? He phones them and they don't pick up. But this would have never happened to Donald Trump. Never. No one was ever ignoring Donald Trump's calls.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think I just saw a pig fly. As for Biden, most Americans disapprove of his job performance. I wonder if he's sick of this stuff.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: I'm sick of this stuff. We have to talk about it because the American people think the reason for inflation is government spending more money. Simply not true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, it is. Oh, my God. Mr. President, what say you?

utterances.speaker: TOM SHILLUE, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Hey, hey, hey. I'm serious, man. This is -- this is no joke. Look, I've had it up to my thyroid. Pretty soon. I'm going to have it up to my occipital. All right? The deal is the American people, I don't know where they get their ideas. The idea that printing money is leading to inflation? I mean, where'd they get that idea? Maybe the 1400 textbooks that have been written on the subject. But look, it's a lot simpler than that. Right? Just supply and demand. All right? We supply the narrative. And we demand you shut up and take it. Come on, man.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Come on, man.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, Bill, there's a theory going around that the further you get from the Trump presidency, the better his era will look. And so, now it's safe for a lot of these guys that just hated him now to go like, oh, they take his phone call. It's like, yes, that's the whole point. You got to have -- you got to have somebody who kind of scares people.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Yes. The thing about Trump is that he was creative every day in office.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Oh, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: I mean, creative. His mind was going.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exhausted.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Whether you agreed or disagreed, or whether you're exhausted or whether you were healed by it. You know, I -- what I think the administration lacks right now is creative thinkers. And the people around the President need to be giving him different ideas. Remember, Trump went to a G20 summit in Japan in June and when he was there, he called Kim Jong- un and said, you want to get together? I'm in the neighborhood.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: And they met at the 39th parallel across the DMZ. And it wasn't like six months of preparation. Hey, we're going to have a summit. We're going to do the deal that -- it was like, the Saturday afternoon and we're going to step across the line and you're going to come back with me. And it was -- it was easy stuff.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: And when you see it happens, the world stops and go wow, that that wasn't hard.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It wasn't and it removes this -- remove this psychological obstacle which was Kim Jong-un was certain we were going to just work.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Without a creative mind, that would have never happened.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Give them credit for that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: My theory on that, Dagen, is that the reason why there are no ideas is because the people around them believe that wokeism is an idea, but it just replaces thought. It's like they've spent so much energy on being Twitter approved in there, you know, and being -- like checking every tolerant box but they actually have no ideas.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: So much time worrying about a threat that isn't a threat and I'm talking about climate change when John Kerry himself said we could take our emissions to zero and it wouldn't change the trajectory of global warming, but that's what they were going to do anyway. There are actually plenty of minds in the White House. Joe Biden chooses to ignore him. Look what happened on Afghanistan. He was told not to do what he did. But I just wanted to thank you for making me watch a 14-minute clip of Trevor Noah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I would rather eat 14 possum sandwiches. Thank you for that.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Those are not good.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Even a little bit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Stringy meat, a lot of hair. You can't get it out, Kat. Remember that time we went to that possum buffet?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: I don't remember.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I don't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do you -- how do you feel about Biden understanding of where inflation comes from? If you create more money, the dollar is cheaper.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes. I think that you usually learned that like middle school, right? Like that's when most people learn it. I -- which also, he probably knows that. I don't think he thinks of the things to say himself. I really don't. So, it's like whoever told him to say that he did a really good job of listening.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. There you go. Tyrus, what do you think?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: I honestly think that my entire image of President Biden with this - - culmination of this is I've -- I used to praise him for being the guy who had the guts to be the vice president to our first black president. Now I see him as an opportunist. That was a great spot for him to be into. It was -- it -- there was no -- there was no downside to it. Anything's wrong. It's the brother's fault. But I had time off in between fishing and lifting weights. I did a lot of research and the one thing that really stuck out to me -- well, it's what you do. Hey, I am what I am. I am what I am. I am what I am.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do you ever get the fish and use --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: You will not get me off topic because this is important to me.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Bill Hemmer is here, you will not embarrass him. So, Ukraine had an election.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: That President -- Vice President Biden at the time was put in charge of.

utterances.speaker: BREAM
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: And him and his what is now the administration did a little bit of what you can only call with interference. Propaganda. They changed influenced the election, which really pissed off a crazy madman in Russia.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

So, all we can do is watch and listen and hope for the best and the best we could hope for that this (BLEEP) stupid horrible thing ends as soon as possible.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Lert's welcome tonight's guests. He's like my stovetop, so hot that I have to remind myself not to touch him. Co-anchor of America's new newsroom, Bill Hemmer.

utterances.speaker: BILL HEMMER, FOX NEWS CHANNEL ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: It would be the new room too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The nude -- how about the nude room? She's got more southern charm than a leprechaun cooking grits. Fox Business anchor Dagen McDowell. She's like a mop, a stick with fake hair that spent a lot of time in the arms of janitors. Fox News Contributor Kat Timpf. And when he springs forward, it causes an earthquake. My massive side kick and the NWA World Television Champion, Tyrus. All right, Tyrus. I'm going to go to you first, even though I got the consummate newsman to my left, I'm going to go to you because you're probably the only person here that we have heard -- well, we haven't heard anything. You've been --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: I got out of town.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You got out of town.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: -- low.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, I'm interested in your perspective. What you think as you watch this unfold on the television?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Well, first things first, I think we got to give credit words to Bill, Mr. Hemmer, you have been outstanding, phenomenal. And Greg, I hardly ever go on social media. But you have taken a tough stand, and you've got a lot of help for it. And I support you a thousand percent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, thank you.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: And it takes -- it's not an easy thing to do in times like this. You know, and every time you give a compliment like that, you have to go back and say what is going on Ukraine is horrible.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: But what's going on here is just is horrible in terms of what information is real and what is not. The American people and myself, we get confused because this administration hasn't been straight with us on one thing and we've been hit with a lot of tough things. We had the pandemic, we have deal -- we're dealing with inflation. There was the -- there was supposed influences in our elections. There was all these things that were happening and we never get the straight and narrow from. They're given Emmys to their own. And then we eventually find out six months later, that we were on the wrong side of everything. Now, I'm not acquainting that to what's going on in Russia because Putin is what he is, and we all know what he is. But getting the information has been extremely difficult. And I left it to the experts. I felt it was best to stay out of this fight. And that's why people like yourself who stood up, I'm just proud of you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, thank you. And you know, agree. I think Hemmer, you've been doing a smashing job with that giant board. The billboard as they've called it. And it makes me forget that you're wearing the silliest shoe.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Oh, the worst.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: With the silliest -- the silliest shoe laces. Those shoe laces cannot remain tied for more than five minutes. Maybe you like it that way, Bill. Maybe like the slip off. But I want to ask you something.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: By the way, they were free.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know, you know.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: That's why --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: And they match great. You don't got to answer to him. Look what he's wearing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm wearing Prada.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: He usually wears velvet strap shoes, so don't worry about it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK. So, Bill.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tyrus brings up the point that I brought up earlier and he's right. I got some serious (BLEEP) for it, but I was trying to address the fog of war. How do we know when we know that we're being persuaded, where the media is now a persuasion device? How do we know -- because like I feel like we're going to go to war.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Yes. I'd say it's persuasive times 20 now with social media.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: I've seen that. It's great to have you back, by the way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: America missed you. I'd come over there and hug you, but they'd start talking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, you know what.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: We're already talking.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'd be whispering in your ear.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: You know, I don't know how to address all that. Maybe in time. That'd be a good moment to look back on it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: But I just think our leaders have thoroughly failed us in the world and all of this. This war did not have to happen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: And the people we have in charge have led us down. And they -- leaders are supposed to lead you around humanitarian international disasters. They're not supposed to lead you into them. And it's such a crisis of leadership. Point number one. Point number two, I don't think the western world tie truly understood the evilness of Vladimir Putin. I think in Ukraine, they probably did. But for us, Aleppo was a planet away.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Grozny, Chechnya was a planet away the refugees in Syria with the Southeastern Turkey. We have -- we couldn't even pronounce the name of the towns. But now the Ukrainians are going to Poland. And after Poland, they're going to go to Germany, then it was Italy earlier today than it'll be England, it'd be the United States. Well, these are all places that we as Americans associate with Europe, summer vacation, college education, et cetera. It's -- we have an ability to relate to these people in a way that we could never during the misdeeds and dare I say evilness of Putin --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Such a good point.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: -- for the past 20 years.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: When you mentioned Chechnya and things like that, it's -- for a lot of people that's the first time they hear and I couldn't explain that without first having to read Wikipedia. Because we -- it was something that wasn't part of our consciousness. It was not part of the world. But this you cannot -- it's there. I mean, we -- you're watching a ground war happening in Europe on T.V. And yet you do feel that there's this other layer going on. Kat, as a libertarian, you support all wars?

utterances.speaker: KAT TIMPF, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: So glad to be back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We missed you, Kat. What's your take on this? I'm dying to hear.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: As you say, I've also not been on T.V. in 2-1/2 weeks.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: So, it's great to start with such this light hearted topic, which I am such an expert. But I -- again, I think you just need to be so careful with this idea of do something, do something because a lot of times are doing something can sometimes make things worse, if you talk about something like a no-fly zone, where, you know, nuclear war, like a war between nuclear powers. A lot of people die in that situation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I think that, you know, it is upsetting and it is awful everything we're seeing, but we got to be really, really, really, really careful in terms of how you approach it and making things potentially worse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. And also, with nuclear war the effect on climate change.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: That's the most important thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes, it is. I mean, aside from two or 300,000 --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: -- by the way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. That was an amazing point to make. Dagen, what -- I haven't heard from you and I've been seeing you in since we went Dallas. Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: She's been killing it on "THE FIVE." She's been killing it on "THE FIVE," Greg.

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, FOX BUSINESS NETWORK ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: I literally hug you and said I love you.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: She was at the same table with you as "THE FIVE."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let's just say that I have spent a lot of time alone.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And no. Maybe I might have had a little too much wine. So, there's a lot of memory. Just that a little foggy.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I hug you and said I love you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, now I feel really bad.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: As you should.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I did a lot of other stuff. So, you know, I remember that. I just thought you invited me on the program to discuss the use of steroids.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you believe that? That baboon is taking steroids?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I have a deep knowledge throughout my history of men using steroids, it's totally possible. He's a little doughy kind of like post steroid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: You got to work out when you take the shot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: And I agree. Right. He looks like he's not, you know, get in the gym and (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Fifty percent doesn't get it done.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I have -- I have a lot -- I don't trust the media like there was a video of these two Ukrainian children who were cheered by their new school in Italy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: And I didn't trust it. I like blue the image up now. That looks like Arkansas to me. There's the anything that's on the internet, I think - -

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I hope that's real. Was that not real? It was Italy.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: No, no. I'm --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. But it's your own -- your brain.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I'm like --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's where I'm at. My brain --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: That could be Kansas.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. My brain, I don't trust anything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think everything taught. What do you call it? A deep fake?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Well, in defense and to Bill's point when we're getting drunk in history by Kamala --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: It's a little difficult. You know, we are first world problems in this country seeing real problems and there's a shock going on right now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: But what you can trust is you follow the money and you follow the oil and natural gas. And at the very beginning of Biden's term, I said it's a mistake to try and destroy our energy, prosperity and power because you see that two nations that hate us, like Vladimir Putin. Every incident of aggression by Putin, in the last 20 years is directly correlated to sky high oil prices.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Interest.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: So you send oil up, he invades Georgia, he annexes Crimea, and now this. But now what you're saying, the energy is still flowing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: It's going to Europe. It's at the highest-level natural gas to Europe, as it has been throughout the war on Ukraine so far. China's still buying it, the vast majority of it -- of Russia's oil exports are still hitting the market. Money's flowing to the Kremlin. And you have a rapid realignment of world powers where China, Xi Jinping is getting invited to Saudi Arabia, and China is getting even closer to Russia because of Biden's weakness.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Are we to think now that in all these summits with Biden, before that Trump, Obama, Bush, did Putin give a damn about cybersecurity? Do we think this now? All Putin cared about was Russian history.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: And all he cared about was real estate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Why didn't we report on that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Old school.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: I found this -- they met in Geneva, it's in June. Ukraine was mentioned one time and a summary recap of the entire summit. And that's a disservice to the American people, to the Western world.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Now we know what Putin cared about.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right. Exactly.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: We never got to that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. All right. We've got a lot to get to. Up -- that's a transition. Ah. Up next, are liberals coming around now that Russian troops are on the ground?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There we go. As the war in Ukraine scrambled the liberal brain, will Biden star fall even lower if he's lost Bill Maher and Trevor Noah? Yes, pretty good, huh? True world leaders won't take Biden's calls as liberal comics finally grow some balls. Bill Maher close to show Friday with one simple question.

utterances.speaker: BILL MAHER, HOST, REAL TIME WITH BILL MAHER
utterances.utterance: If Putin thought Trump was really that supportive of him, why didn't he invade when Trump was in office? It's at least worth asking that question if you're not locked into one intransigent thought.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Hmm. Great question, Bill. Concerning a recent Harvard poll that was my porn stage name, show that 62 percent of voters think Putin would not have attacked if Trump were still around. Meanwhile, Daily Show host Trevor Noah offers a rant that leaves us wondering what the hell happened to him.

utterances.speaker: TREVOR NOAH, HOST, THE DAILY SHOW
utterances.utterance: Apparently, Saudi Arabia won't even pick up the phone for the President of the United States. It must have been really embarrassing for Biden, can you imagine? He phones them and they don't pick up. But this would have never happened to Donald Trump. Never. No one was ever ignoring Donald Trump's calls.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think I just saw a pig fly. As for Biden, most Americans disapprove of his job performance. I wonder if he's sick of this stuff.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: I'm sick of this stuff. We have to talk about it because the American people think the reason for inflation is government spending more money. Simply not true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it is. Oh, my God. Mr. President, what say you?

utterances.speaker: TOM SHILLUE, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Hey, hey, hey. I'm serious, man. This is -- this is no joke. Look, I've had it up to my thyroid. Pretty soon. I'm going to have it up to my occipital. All right? The deal is the American people, I don't know where they get their ideas. The idea that printing money is leading to inflation? I mean, where'd they get that idea? Maybe the 1400 textbooks that have been written on the subject. But look, it's a lot simpler than that. Right? Just supply and demand. All right? We supply the narrative. And we demand you shut up and take it. Come on, man.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Come on, man.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, Bill, there's a theory going around that the further you get from the Trump presidency, the better his era will look. And so, now it's safe for a lot of these guys that just hated him now to go like, oh, they take his phone call. It's like, yes, that's the whole point. You got to have -- you got to have somebody who kind of scares people.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Yes. The thing about Trump is that he was creative every day in office.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Oh, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: I mean, creative. His mind was going.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exhausted.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Whether you agreed or disagreed, or whether you're exhausted or whether you were healed by it. You know, I -- what I think the administration lacks right now is creative thinkers. And the people around the President need to be giving him different ideas. Remember, Trump went to a G20 summit in Japan in June and when he was there, he called Kim Jong- un and said, you want to get together? I'm in the neighborhood.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: And they met at the 39th parallel across the DMZ. And it wasn't like six months of preparation. Hey, we're going to have a summit. We're going to do the deal that -- it was like, the Saturday afternoon and we're going to step across the line and you're going to come back with me. And it was -- it was easy stuff.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: And when you see it happens, the world stops and go wow, that that wasn't hard.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It wasn't and it removes this -- remove this psychological obstacle which was Kim Jong-un was certain we were going to just work.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Without a creative mind, that would have never happened.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Give them credit for that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: My theory on that, Dagen, is that the reason why there are no ideas is because the people around them believe that wokeism is an idea, but it just replaces thought. It's like they've spent so much energy on being Twitter approved in there, you know, and being -- like checking every tolerant box but they actually have no ideas.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: So much time worrying about a threat that isn't a threat and I'm talking about climate change when John Kerry himself said we could take our emissions to zero and it wouldn't change the trajectory of global warming, but that's what they were going to do anyway. There are actually plenty of minds in the White House. Joe Biden chooses to ignore him. Look what happened on Afghanistan. He was told not to do what he did. But I just wanted to thank you for making me watch a 14-minute clip of Trevor Noah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I would rather eat 14 possum sandwiches. Thank you for that.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Those are not good.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Even a little bit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Stringy meat, a lot of hair. You can't get it out, Kat. Remember that time we went to that possum buffet?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: I don't remember.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I don't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you -- how do you feel about Biden understanding of where inflation comes from? If you create more money, the dollar is cheaper.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes. I think that you usually learned that like middle school, right? Like that's when most people learn it. I -- which also, he probably knows that. I don't think he thinks of the things to say himself. I really don't. So, it's like whoever told him to say that he did a really good job of listening.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. There you go. Tyrus, what do you think?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: I honestly think that my entire image of President Biden with this - - culmination of this is I've -- I used to praise him for being the guy who had the guts to be the vice president to our first black president. Now I see him as an opportunist. That was a great spot for him to be into. It was -- it -- there was no -- there was no downside to it. Anything's wrong. It's the brother's fault. But I had time off in between fishing and lifting weights. I did a lot of research and the one thing that really stuck out to me -- well, it's what you do. Hey, I am what I am. I am what I am. I am what I am.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you ever get the fish and use --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: You will not get me off topic because this is important to me.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Bill Hemmer is here, you will not embarrass him. So, Ukraine had an election.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: That President -- Vice President Biden at the time was put in charge of.

utterances.speaker: BREAM
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: And him and his what is now the administration did a little bit of what you can only call with interference. Propaganda. They changed influenced the election, which really pissed off a crazy madman in Russia.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Then, lo and behold, his son gets kush jobs, there's a lot of kickbacks, money's being traced. So, there's a little pattern between Ukraine and Biden. Biden gets into the White House. And that crazy psycho who no longer has a friendly government working with him anymore. You don't think he's going to do something? So, the answer, would he have done it under President Trump? No, he wouldn't have because he wasn't -- fear of President Trump putting NATO in his backyard, which was a red line for him which he just assumed and I'm just -- put it out there, just assumed that was going to happen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right. Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: And the other thing I like to say, President Trump, the one thing that I missed was one, and then we know this is true. He calls me the fine. He would stop the cade to get out and check gas prices at gas stations, and he would ask Secret Service to tell him how much was on the pump. Because that was important to him. He was proud of that. I miss having a president who was proud of things in America, not the opportunities that he has because that's what he looks like now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Here we go. Up next, my favorite story, Jesse's back and in prison.

utterances.speaker: JONATHAN HUNT, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: This is a Fox News alert. I'm Jonathan Hunt in Ukraine. Talks between the Russian and Ukrainian sides are due to get underway again Tuesday. But ahead of those talks, Russia appears to be pursuing its scorched earth policy. This video is of (INAUDIBLE), a southern city and it shows many buildings reduced to complete rubble. We do not have any accurate count on the number of civilian casualties. Also, in Mariupol we have video of Ukrainian forces destroying Russian tanks. The video shot from inside one of the units operating by the Ukrainians. In Kyiv, the bombardment keeps going -- again apartments, buildings targeted, civilians among the casualties. I'm Jonathan Hunt in Lviv. Stay with Fox News for continuing coverage. Now back to the show.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.utterance: He went from empire to dumpster fire. Last week, alleged actor, Jussie Smollett, was sentenced to five months behind bars or staging a hate crime in 2019, to be found guilty on five counts of felony disorderly conduct, and one count of possessing a sandwich from Subway. Here's some in depth psycho-analysis from the judge.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: You have another side of you that is profoundly arrogant and self, selfish and narcissistic. That's the only thing that can be concluded, and it's so unfortunate. Your very name has become an advert for lying. And I cannot imagine what could be worse than that. You were actually throwing a national pity party for yourself -- why would you do such thing?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's a judge. I think the judge confused adverbs and synonyms. But we'll move on. And the hair? Let's, let's talk about that. Moments later, Smollett proclaimed his innocence ranting that he wasn't suicidal.

utterances.speaker: JUSSIE SMOLLETT, ACTOR
utterances.utterance: I am not suicidal. I am not suicidal. And I'm innocent. I could have said that I was guilty a long time ago.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. That makes me think he's got dirt on the Clintons. So, now, Smollett's in the psych ward at a Chicago jail which is still safer than the streets. Meanwhile, he still has defenders who argue the punishment didn't fit the crime since no one was injured after all, and they're half right -- his punishment doesn't fit; it should have been much more harsh. His greed and lust for fame made America's race relations worse and at the worst possible time. But I guess in pretending to be a victim while smearing others as violent racist means jail time, then we need to lock up millions of Democrats.
